Experience a wide range of settings and situations—embark on an Ace Attorney-like detective adventure in Murders on the Yangtze River, play as a literal clue-collecting alligator in BROK the InvestiGator, or go the sci-fi detective route in Between Horizons. Pay what you want and help support Girls Who Code with your purchase!
basic_data.description:
Play marquee mystery & thriller titles. Put on your thinking caps, gather clues, and solve mysteries from the humid lowlands of the swamp to the depths of space with the Case & Consequence Collection. Experience a wide range of settings and situations—embark on an Ace Attorney-like detective adventure in Murders on the Yangtze River, play as a literal clue-collecting alligator in BROK the InvestiGator, or go the sci-fi detective route in Between Horizons. Pay what you want and help support Girls Who Code with your purchase!

Pay $6 or more. Normally, the total cost for the games in this bundle is as much as $136. Here at Humble Bundle, you choose the price and increase your contribution to upgrade your bundle! This bundle has a minimum $6 purchase. Pay $6 or more to access Steam keys.

Redeem on Steam. All of the games in this bundle are available on Steam for Windows — and some for Mac and Linux too. Please review the system requirements here prior to purchasing.

Support charity. Choose where the money goes - between the publishers and to support Girls Who Code. If you like what we do, you can leave us a Humble Tip too!

murdersontheyangtzeriver.description_text:
If you're a fan of "Ace Attorney", you won't want to miss "Murders on Yangtze River", a horizontal axis detective game developed by OMEGames Studio.

The game takes you on a journey through early 20th century China as you solve a series of intriguing cases along the Yangtze River. With its stunning brush painting art style and engaging storyline, it offers a unique gaming experience that will keep you on the edge of your seat.

Use your logical reasoning and deduction skills to uncover clues, interrogate suspects, and solve the mysteries. With challenging puzzles and interesting characters to meet, "Murders on the Yangtze River" will have you hooked from the very beginning.

Engaging Stories
Embark on a thrilling journey full of extraordinary cases and plot twists! Players take on the role John Shen, a traveling detective who seeks truth and revenge for his brother’s death. Along his journey, he encounters numerous cases that are full of mystery, drama and suspense.

Memorable Characters
The game has many unforgettable characters. John Shen, for instance, is a refined gentleman with a sharp intellect. But as you delve deeper, you discover that he harbors a darker side to his personality. His vivacious assistant, Frankie, is a beacon of positivity who is always eager to use his technological inventions in their investigations.

Rigorous Logical Reasoning
Investigate crime scenes, search for evidence, debate with suspects, and identify the murderer using collected clues. Find contradictions within testimonies and unravel the mystery. There are also many challenging puzzles. Get ready for a gripping adventure!

Easy Access
The game features an intuitive tutorial that starts off with straightforward controls and simple cases, gradually building up to more challenging scenarios. Whether you're a seasoned player or new to the game, it's designed to be easy to pick up and play at any skill level.

Pleasant Journey on a Chinese-style Ink Wash Picture Scroll
Journey through a beautiful ink wash landscape painting of China's mountains and rivers from a hundred years ago. Explore picturesque Dongting Lake, Yangzhou and Shanghai. Immerse yourself in local customs in this extraordinary picture scroll.

[Main Story]
John Shen, the protagonist of this story, studied law in London alongside his brother, who was studying biology. One day, Shen's brother was found dead in his dormitory, and the police ruled his death as suicide. But when Shen stumbled upon a newly published detective novel on Shanghai News that depicted a murder scene identical to his brother's death, he began to suspect foul play. Convinced that the amateur writer was somehow involved in his brother's death, Shen returned to China to uncover the truth.

heavyrain.description_text:
HOW FAR WILL YOU GO TO SAVE SOMEONE YOU LOVE?

Experience a gripping psychological thriller filled with innumerable twists and turns. Spanning four days of mystery and suspense, the hunt is on for a murderer known only as the Origami Killer - named after his macabre calling card of leaving behind folded paper shapes at crime scenes. Four characters, each following their own leads and with their own motives, must take part in a desperate attempt to prevent the killer from claiming a new victim.

You need to think fast and act even faster, as every choice and move you make can result in dramatic, game-changing consequences – and even determine who lives… and who dies.

How this story ends is entirely up to you.

FOUR CHARACTERS, FOUR PERSPECTIVES
The award-winning storyline puts you in control of four distinct characters who are each following their own leads in a desperate search for a missing person.

ACCESSIBLE AND INTUITIVE CONTROLS
Not limited by gaming conventions, the uncomplicated HUD keeps you deeply immersed in the storytelling and features controls for both gamepad and keyboard/mouse players.

FULLY OPTIMIZED FOR PC
The classic title is brought to PC with stunning visuals including 4K resolution and 60 fps framerate.

lacunaasci_finoiradventure.description_text:
Another cigarette tumbles into the abyss. The sun is slowly coming up, glistening in the sea of buildings below.

I look up at the stars one last time before they disappear. They don't provide any guidance. They don't give a f*ck.

I have to make this decision on my own, and very soon. Problem is, I don't know how. I've never been able to figure out why I do what I do. Not really.

No more time to think. I have to go.

Here's the deal

You are Neil Conrad, CDI agent. Awoken by the news of a murder, you rush into a case that will soon turn your life and the whole solar system upside down. Ask questions, collect evidence, and put the pieces together until the ugly truth reveals itself... or not.

No takebacks

The story branches and ends based on your actions. There's no going back. Sure, you can rush your way to the end – if you don't mind paying the price. Play your cards right, and you might make it out alive.

How far will you go?

Some questions don't have a right answer. Will you sell out a friend to protect your family? Will you endanger a loved one in exchange for public safety? Will you keep the peace or reveal the horrible, world-shattering truth?

Hungry for an Adventure?

While the classics were great in their time, Lacuna does away with the baggage of many adventure game tropes:

  • No pointing & clicking -> Platformer movement controls (WASD / controller)
  • No selecting all dialog options one by one anyway -> Non-repeating conversations and choices
  • No inventory management and counter-intuitive puzzles -> Immersive, story-driven mysteries
  • No pixel hunting -> Optional outlines on anything interactable
  • No grinds to a halt at every puzzle -> Story can always be driven forward
  • No "x will remember this" -> Real choices and multiple endings

songoffarca.description_text:
Song of Farca takes place in the near future, where technology isn't just part of everyday life – some things are now impossible without it. IT corporations gradually gain more and more influence, becoming a modern aristocracy that couldn't care less about the law or mere mortals. Criminal organizations are still trying to resist the powerful corporations, but even they understand that the city of Farca is entering a cyberpunk future. They know that their golden age is over.

As private detective Isabella Song, you must navigate the city's disparate factions and investigate the most complex, seemingly unrelated cases with the help of gadgets, a small army of drones, and your intellect. Though Izy is under house arrest after a bar fight, that won’t stop her from doing her job. Getting online is no problem for a hacker, after all.

You must uncover information through hacking, surveillance, and the internet, create an information cloud from leads and logically connect them to draw conclusions and apply them in dialogues.

As the plot progresses, things get more complicated. The stakes get higher, and the various plot strands come together to form a single story. The choices you make in investigations have important consequences to the plot. Do you convict the suspect that all the evidence is pointing to or dig deeper? What collateral damage will you leave behind you?

sherlockholmes_crimesandpunishments.description_text:
Become the most celebrated detective of all time: Sherlock Holmes ! Use your impressive talents as a detective to solve six thrilling and varied cases: murders, missing persons, spectacular thefts and numerous investigations that sometimes lead you into the realms of the fantastic.

Will you follow your moral compass, or will you apply the letter of the law?

The great freedom of action in Crimes & Punishments allows you to conduct your investigations in the manner you deem appropriate. Use the 14 extraordinary skills of detection for which Sherlock is famous, choose the avenues of enquiry you wish to pursue, interrogate your suspects and, from your deductions, name the guilty parties... you can even determine their fate! The ramifications are far-reaching, and your decisions will exert a real influence through your reputation or the surprising consequences that will arise where you least expect them…

girlswhocode.description_text:
Donations to support Girls Who Code are made to  PayPal Giving Fund, subject to its policies.

Girls Who Code, a nonprofit organization, was founded in 2012 to encourage more young women to complete a college-level computer science education and gain skills to further enhance their employability. Mobilizing leading executives, educators, and engineers, Girls Who Code has developed a new model of computer science education designed to inspire, educate, and equip girls of all experience levels and backgrounds with the skills to succeed in the field.

In just three years, Girls Who Code has already begun to move the needle: through rapid iteration and expansion of our Summer Immersion Program and highly-scalable Clubs Program, Girls Who Code has delivered 3,000+ hours of instruction to 3,000+ girls nationwide. Our programs have earned support from the CEOs of top Fortune 500 companies, engaged 700+ industry professionals, delivered among the most robust dataset on computer science education, and been featured in 100+ publications, from The New York Times to the Today Show. Our alumnae are overwhelmingly choosing to major in computer science or related studies and consistently name Girls Who Code's programs as their chief incentive to do so.

Girls Who Code is dedicated to closing the gender gap in the technology world. Supporting the work of Girls Who Code is an opportunity to empower the engineers, innovators, and executives of tomorrow.

broktheinvestigator.description_text:
"Brok" is a narrative-driven game that blends action, puzzles and investigation in never-before-seen ways. Will you use your brain... or your brawn?

In a futuristic "light cyberpunk" world where animals have replaced humans, privileged citizens live under a protective dome from the ambient air pollution while others struggle to make a living on the outside.

Brok, private detective and former boxer, lives with Graff, the son of his deceased wife. Although he could never elucidate the nature behind her accident, recent events may shed some light on an even more tragic outcome... one that may be linked to their own existence.

Will they be able to withstand the threats of this corrupted world and face their own destiny?

FEATURES

A deep and emotional narrative-rich experience filled with characters reminiscent of classic 80s/90s cartoons.
The first game to combine a "Classic Adventure" with "Beat'em up" and RPG elements!

- Solve puzzles with your wits... or muscles!
- Make choices impacting gameplay and/or story
- Easy mode for pure "Point & Click" gameplay (fights can be skipped)
- Level up to beat enemies and bosses
- Combine clues to uncover the truth!
- In-game hints
- Two playable characters, switch at any time
- 15 to 20 hours long on first playthrough
- Multiple distinct endings to unlock
- Fully voice acted (23,000 lines)
- All controls supported (mouse, keyboard or controller)

Verified compatible with Steam Deck and Linux/Proton.

betweenhorizons.human_name: Between Horizons – A Sci-Fi Detective Adventure
betweenhorizons.description_text:
ABOUT THE GAME

Between Horizons is set aboard the Zephyr, humanity's first generation ship en route to another star. You assume the role of Stella, who was born on the ship 24 years ago and recently inherited her father's post as Chief of Security. Dive into the conspiracy behind the incident that threatens to disrupt the Zephyr's social order and foil its mission.

Between Horizons is a modern 2.5D pixel art adventure that brings a branching narrative into a semi-open world. The team at DigiTales has applied numerous lessons from their first game Lacuna and proven solutions to detective game design problems to maximize player agency in the investigation process – all the while maintaining the tight pacing of a meaningful story that will ask you to reevaluate your moral compass and make increasingly tough decisions as the situation aboard the ship spirals out of control.

Features
  • A New Kind of Experience: Between Horizons merges investigative-style gameplay with a branching sci-fi story in an ever-expanding Metroidvania-style environment.
  • Solving Cases for Yourself: The flexible evidence system lets players assign clues to cases, confront ship denizens about them, and submit any case with evidence players have connected to it. Everything found on the ship is connected, but figuring out how — that’s the challenge.
  • At What Cost?: Underneath the game's exciting and plausible sci-fi plot lies a number of thought-provoking problems inviting players to weigh intergenerational responsibility against personal freedom.
  • Getting New Perspective: Timeless pixel art mixed with 3D environments and compelling visual effects come together in Between Horizons, creating a unique, beautiful art style.
  • Failure is Very Much an Option: There are no second chances — submitting wrong solutions means the story will go on and players live with the consequences. A new and improved auto-save system will make sure there is no going back, as the story branches and endings are based on player decisions, none of which can be taken back.

girlswhocode.description_text:
Donations to support Girls Who Code are made to  PayPal Giving Fund, subject to its policies.

Girls Who Code, a nonprofit organization, was founded in 2012 to encourage more young women to complete a college-level computer science education and gain skills to further enhance their employability. Mobilizing leading executives, educators, and engineers, Girls Who Code has developed a new model of computer science education designed to inspire, educate, and equip girls of all experience levels and backgrounds with the skills to succeed in the field.

season_alettertothefuture.human_name: SEASON: A letter to the future
season_alettertothefuture.callout:
93% Positive on Steam

Capture the beauty of a world on the brink of change.
season_alettertothefuture.description_text:
• A bicycle road trip : Explore a new world and wind your way through stunning landscapes on your bicycle.
  • Document, photograph, and record : Collect memories, make recordings and capture the most important moments from the current season to preserve them for future generations.
  • A highly customizable journal : Piece together the secrets of the world of SEASON before a cataclysm washes everything away.
  • Emotionally complex characters : Meet a diverse cast of characters, each of whom has two precious things to share with you: the stories of their lives and a moment together at the end of the season.

haroldhalibut.callout:
84% Positive on Steam

Uncover secrets in a charming, hand-crafted universe.
haroldhalibut.description_text:
Harold Halibut is a handmade narrative game about friendship and life on a city-sized spaceship submerged in an alien ocean.

It’s been 250 years since your home - an ark-like spaceship - fled an Earth on the verge of cold war to find a habitable planet to preserve the human race.

You are Harold, a young lab assistant for the ship’s lead scientist, Jeanne Mareaux. While most of the ship’s inhabitants have reconciled themselves to a life lived aboard the sunken ship, Mareaux still works tirelessly to find a way for the ship to leave the planet and find a new, dryer home.

But the weird, wonderful and diverse people of the FEDORA I keep Harold busy too… Until one fateful encounter plunges Harold into a world no one could have imagined - and one that may hold the key to Mareaux’s re-launch plans.

Join Harold as he explores a vibrant retro-future world in his quest to find the true meaning of ‘home’.

Features:
  • Unique Stop-Motion Aesthetics: Every element in Harold Halibut is a tactile and meticulously hand-crafted using traditional sculpting and model-making techniques.
  • Full Voice Acting: All of the Fedoras' wonderful inhabitants come to life with full English voiceover, elevating the game's narrative to cinematic proportions.
  • An expansive Character Ensemble: Meet a variety of unique characters and get to know their personalities, quirks and stories through meaningful conversations.
  • A riveting cinematic storyline: Journey through a captivating narrative, underscored by a carefully orchestrated script that blends drama, humor, and suspense.

frankanddrake.callout:
91% Positive on Steam

Gothic tales, twin destinies, shadowy secrets.
frankanddrake.description_text:
Frank and Drake are brought together by unknown forces in a conspiracy that threatens them both. Sharing the same apartment, though destined never to meet, they must work together to uncover the mystery shrouding both their existences.

Frank is the super of a run-down apartment block in Oriole City, worried he is losing his mind and what little remains of his connection to the world around him. Drake is allergic to sunlight and operates by night. Their split existence means they must communicate via sticky notes left around the apartment. Despite this separation, they must forge a relationship, uncover the truth and survive.

The game is set in Oriole City, a richly detailed and beautifully illustrated setting, with remarkable characters, and secrets to unearth. Frank and Drake must explore these surroundings, solve puzzles and discover clues that will help them find the answers they desperately seek, to their respective troubled pasts. Though they must work separately, their fates are intertwined and depend on the trust and friendship they forge together.

The mystery unfolds via a branching narrative, where the choices you make will have a profound impact on the events both protagonists experience. Multiple playthroughs will be rewarded with the discovery of new perspectives on the story, as well as unique puzzles and mini-games. Which path will you choose? Will you discover all the secrets hidden in the world?

Frank and Drake employs a beautiful graphical style that represents the unnerving and dreamlike existence that both characters feel with the world around them. The rotoscoping style is a painstaking process of hand drawing frames over filmed footage. The uncanny result reflects Frank and Drake’s realities: two extraordinary characters trying to blend into an ordinary world.

sixages2_lightsgoingout.callout:
97% Positive on Steam

A rich, text-based strategy game of myth and survival.
sixages2_lightsgoingout.description_text:
Life after myths. Death, disaster, despair.

This new installment in the Six Ages series is a stand-alone survival-storybook combining interactive fiction and turn-based strategy. The world is ending, and your small clan’s survival depends on how you manage its relationship with the remaining gods and their followers.

Managing your clan is complex, but may require you to:
  • explore the wilderness
  • trade with (or raid!) your neighbors
  • settle disputes mundane, spiritual, or political
  • improve livestock pastures
  • make offerings
  • build altars
  • travel to the Otherworld

Whether you’re dealing with angry ghosts or clan policy, there’s rarely one “right” or “wrong” answer, because the deep simulation will make your particular situation unique. Remember that your choices have socio-economic impact, and your advisors often squabble amongst themselves, but some consequences might not be obvious for decades.

Your clan struggles to survive in the world of Glorantha, one of the richest, oldest game settings ever created, perhaps familiar from other games such as RuneQuest or King of Dragon Pass. This bronze age world is facing an existential crisis as it undergoes a transformation. Ten generations after the events of Ride Like the Wind, some gods have already perished and humanity itself seems to be on the brink of annihilation. Here, the laws of physics themselves are subordinate to the whims of the gods and spirits.

In Lights Going Out, you can continue a game you began in Six Ages: Ride Like the Wind, or start a new story in this Great Darkness.

Six Ages 2: Lights Going Out is immensely replayable, with over 600(!) interactive scenes with multiple, system-driven outcomes. Short episodes and automatic saving mean you can play even when you only have a minute or two. The built-in saga records your story for you, while advisors help you track your promises, though their personalities will often judge your actions.

Miracles have always required sacrifice. Now, your people need them more than ever, but the costs are higher, too. Is it worth aiding the destructive gods of Chaos to ensure your own survival?

mutazione.callout:
95% Positive on Steam

Explore a hand-drawn island and uncover its mysteries among a vibrant mutant community.
mutazione.description_text:
A mutant soap opera where small-town gossip meets the supernatural...

MUTAZIONE is an adventure game where the juicy personal drama is just as important as the high-stakes adventure part of the story.

Explore the community as 15-year-old Kai as she travels to the strange and secretive community of Mutazione to care for her ailing grandfather, Nonno.

Make new friends; plant musical gardens; attend BBQs, band nights and boat trips; and embark on a final spiritual journey to save everyone from the strange darkness at the heart of it all.

Over 100 years ago, the meteor “Moon Dragon” struck a tropical holiday resort. Most of the inhabitants perished, while those who survived began to show strange mutations... The rescue missions quickly retreated, and those who remained in the mutating environment founded the small and isolated community of Mutazione.

Fast-forward to modern day, where you play as 15-year-old Kai as she travels to Mutazione to help nurse her dying grandfather back to health. But things aren’t as simple as they seem... Nonno has other plans for Kai; secrets and betrayals simmer under the friendly community’s surface; and there’s a creepy bird-like figure who keeps on appearing in Kai’s dreams.

They can survive an apocalyptic meteor strike, but can they survive their small-town drama?

dustborn.callout:
74% Positive on Steam

Rally your crew for an emotional, powered-up odyssey.
dustborn.description_text:
Dustborn is a single-player, story-driven action-adventure game about hope, love, friendships, robots…and the power of words.

You play Pax: exile, con-artist, Anomal — with the ability to weaponize language. Looking for a new life and a way out, Pax has been hired to transport an important package from Pacifica to Nova Scotia, across the Justice-controlled American Republic. Sounds like a legit reason for a road-trip, right?

So pack your bags, assemble a crew with their own peculiar powers, and get ready to travel the country!

Explore the stunning Neo-Western landscapes of an alternate history America on a robot-driven tour bus, and stop at a dozen locations along the road to build your crew, manage relationships, complete missions, and face increasingly difficult challenges. But the people you stole the package from want it back, and the authoritarian Justice is hot on your heels, so don’t forget to pack your baseball bat!

(And, oh yeah, you’re travelling undercover as a punk-rock band, so you’ll definitely need to brush up on your musical skills before your next gig.)

At the end of the road lies salvation…but to get there, you’ll need to cross an entire continent.

Words have power. Like, actual power. Fight with Shouts and use Vox in conversations to manipulate people and talk your way out of hairy situations. Craft new words, and learn to wield a lingual arsenal against enemies...and friends.

On the road across an alternate history America, you’ll stop at iconic locations, take on unexpected assignments, meet a colorful cast of characters, enlist new crew members, and evade (or fight) your pursuers. See beautiful sights along the highway, rendered in a colorful graphic-novel-inspired art style that brings stunning 2D illustrations to 3D life.

Your crew is your (found) family. Round up, manage and lean on a motley mob of misfits with peculiar powers, compelling stories and clashing personalities. Branching dialogues lead to choices that shape relationships and change how your crew feels about themselves and others.

In each location you’ll explore, investigate and chat with the people you meet, use the crew to overcome challenges, craft new Shouts and Vox, and rehearse with your band. You might also find yourself throwing Molotov cocktails from a motorbike, swing a baseball bat to take down helicopters…and more. You know, just normal everyday stuff.

venba.callout:
93% Positive on Steam

Stir up delicious dishes and heartfelt family memories.
venba.description_text:
Venba is a game about an immigrant mother, her family and the role food plays in connecting different generations. It is a short and sweet cinematic experience that you can enjoy in a 1 to 2 hour sitting.

Cook and learn authentic food from regional South Indian cuisine.
Idlis, Dosas, and Biriyanis!! Whether you’re a new or regular eater of South Indian cuisine, there’s something delectable to discover in this short foodie puzzle game.

Discover a heartfelt story of family, love, loss, and more
Restore lost recipes and explore this family’s story as they grow and change through a journey of love, loss, and more. Experience a story of culture and and self-discovery.

Feast your eyes on delicious visuals
Stylized art and a distinctive color palette bring the food and story to life! So good you can almost taste it.

Jam to tunes inspired by Tamil Music
Move over lo-fi beats! Our unique original soundtrack is inspired by and pays homage to Tamil music throughout the ages. An In-game radio will play songs as you cook and make you feel like you are stepping into this family's kitchen

itgetsbetter.description_text:
Donations to support It Gets Better are made to  PayPal Giving Fund, subject to its policies.

It Gets Better's mission is to communicate to lesbian, gay, bisexual and transgender youth around the world that it gets better, and to create and inspire the changes needed to make it better for them.

Growing up isn’t easy. Many young people face daily tormenting and bullying, leading them to feel like they have nowhere to turn. This is especially true for LGBT kids and teens who often hide their sexuality for fear of bullying. Without other openly gay adults and mentors in their lives, they can't imagine what their future may hold.

It Gets Better was created to show young LGBT people the levels of happiness, potential, and positivity their lives will reach. It Gets Better wants to remind youth in the LGBT community that they are not alone — and it will get better.

Donations to support It Gets Better are made to  PayPal Giving Fund, subject to its policies.

It Gets Better's mission is to communicate to lesbian, gay, bisexual and transgender youth around the world that it gets better, and to create and inspire the changes needed to make it better for them.

Growing up isn’t easy. Many young people face daily tormenting and bullying, leading them to feel like they have nowhere to turn. This is especially true for LGBT kids and teens who often hide their sexuality for fear of bullying. Without other openly gay adults and mentors in their lives, they can't imagine what their future may hold.

It Gets Better was created to show young LGBT people the levels of happiness, potential, and positivity their lives will reach. It Gets Better wants to remind youth in the LGBT community that they are not alone — and it will get better.

from_bundle.tile_short_name: Narrative Arc Bundle
from_bundle.short_marketing_blurb: Lose yourself in great game storytelling
from_bundle.marketing_blurb: Get Venba, Dustborn, Harold Halibut, Six Ages 2: Lights Going Out, SEASON: A letter to the future, and more!
from_bundle.detailed_marketing_blurb: The core beauty of video games lies in their ability to emotionally connect with players through gripping narratives, and our latest bundle celebrates games with beautiful storytelling. Explore themes of hope, love, and friendship in Dustborn, experience a standalone survival storybook that blends interactive fiction with turn-based strategy in Six Ages 2: Lights Going Out, and ride, record, meet people, and unravel the strange world around you in SEASON: A letter to the future—and more. Pay what you want and help support the It Gets Better Project with your purchase!
from_bundle.author: Publishers

basic_data.human_name: Learn Game Dev with Unity, Godot, Unreal, GameMaker, Blender & C#
basic_data.detailed_marketing_blurb: Passionate about video games? Then start making your own! Our latest bundle will help you learn vital game development skills. Master the most popular creation platforms like Unity, Godot, Unreal, GameMaker, Blender, and C#—now that’s a sharp-lookin’ bundle! Build a 2.5D farming RPG with Unreal Engine, create a micro turn-based RPG in Godot, explore game optimization, and so much more. Get the expert advice and knowledge you need to become an elite game creator, and help support CARE with your purchase!
basic_data.description:
Make games like a pro. Passionate about video games? Then start making your own! Our latest bundle will help you learn vital game development skills. Master the most popular creation platforms like Unity, Godot, Unreal, GameMaker, Blender, and C#—now that’s a sharp-lookin’ bundle! Build a 2.5D farming RPG with Unreal Engine, create a micro turn-based RPG in Godot, explore game optimization, and so much more. Get the expert advice and knowledge you need to become an elite game creator, and help support CARE with your purchase!

Pay $1 or more. Normally, the total cost for the software in this bundle is as much as $1,750. Here at Humble Bundle, you choose the price and increase your contribution to upgrade your bundle! This bundle has a minimum $1 purchase. Pay $1 or more to access keys.

Redeem your keys. All keys can be redeemed on the Zenva website.

Support charity. Choose where the money goes - between the developer and to support Care.Org. If you like what we do, you can leave us a Humble Tip too!

uvmappinginblenderforbeginners.human_name: UV Mapping in Blender for Beginners
uvmappinginblenderforbeginners.description_text:
Master texturing in Blender by learning how to use UV maps!

UV mapping - a process by which you ""unwrap"" a 3D model into a flat surface - offers creators an easy way to paint complex textures and apply them to 3D models. You'll explore creating and applying UV maps to primitive objects, as well as complex.

Regardless of the sort of model you're making, skills in UV mapping will provide you with key skills to customize your 3D graphics to your exact specifications and allow you to go beyond flat colors for your textures.

You will learn how to:

  • Apply textures to an object
  • Create UV maps for primitive shapes
  • Build models suitable for UV mapping
  • Combine techniques to unwrap complex objects
  • Export UV maps for 2D graphic's software
  • Paint textures onto a flattened UV map

introtounrealenginegamedevelopment.human_name: Intro to Unreal Engine Game Development
introtounrealenginegamedevelopment.description_text:
Learn the first steps to building beautiful games with Unreal Engine!

Known for its high-quality rendering, Unreal Engine is one of the most popular engines available. With its easy-to-use Blueprints Visual Scripting system and high-powered performance, it's used by developers around the world.

Through this course, you'll master the basics of Unreal and discover key features and tools for building your future games. No matter what genre you're interested in, these foundations will prepare you to tackle any kind of Unreal project!

No prior Unreal Engine skills are needed for this course.

You will learn how to:

  • Navigate Unreal Engine
  • Rotate, scale, and move objects
  • Add lights and physics
  • Work with Blueprints
  • Visually script game logic
  • Set up a basic player

... and more!

createaturn-basedminirpginunrealengine.human_name: Create a Turn-Based Mini RPG in Unreal Engine
createaturn-basedminirpginunrealengine.description_text:
Build a turn-based mini RPG from start to finish in Unreal Engine!

Turn-based battle systems offer strategic depth for creating immersive and engaging RPG experiences. In this course, you'll construct a 2.5D, turn-based RPG featuring magic spells, healing, and more - all with simple UI controls. These skills will empower you to expand into more sophisticated RPG development and master class construction using Unreal's Blueprints.

This course requires basic familiarity with Unreal Engine and the Blueprints Visual Script system.

You’ll learn how to:

  • Create dynamic player/enemy classes
  • Develop turn-based game logic
  • Use UI for character control
  • Build a 2.5D game world
  • Work with projectiles and healing
  • Add game juice with SFX

... and more!

3daction-adventuregameingodot_unit1_char.human_name: 3D Action-Adventure Game in Godot - Unit 1 - Characters
3daction-adventuregameingodot_unit1_char.description_text:
Build an epic 3D action-adventure game from start to finish!

Action-adventure games, with their immersive gameplay and dynamic challenges, are a staple of modern gaming. Through this course, you'll explore the basics of creating characters in Godot - developing smooth animations, dynamic combat mechanics, and randomized enemies to bring your game to life. By mastering these techniques, you’ll be ready to expand into creating other 3D genres with confidence and add more advanced features to your action-adventure project.

You’ll learn how to:

  • Design and configure a 3D character
  • Animate actions with Godot’s animation trees
  • Add multiple weapons and shields
  • Generate enemies with random appearances
  • Program player combat mechanics, including defending
  • Work with inheritance for cleaner code

... and more!

comprehensiveintroductiontocprogramming.human_name: The Comprehensive Introduction to C# Programming
comprehensiveintroductiontocprogramming.description_text:
Jumpstart your programming journey with the C# language!

Developed by Microsoft, C# is a versatile and robust language powering everything from simple applications to complex software systems. In this course, you'll dive deep into C# and explore foundational programming topics - all while cementing your learning with real-world examples and exercises. By the end, you'll have the foundational knowledge to excel in web development, mobile app creation, and even game development using major frameworks like Unity and MonoGame.

You'll learn how to:

  • Set up a C# development environment
  • Understand C# syntax and execution
  • Process and manipulate data
  • Store data - including with collections
  • Create efficient code with loops and methods
  • Apply fundamentals to real-world examples

... and more!

uiuxforgamedesign.description_text:
Discover UI and UX design principles for games!

The user interface (UI) and user experience (UX) play a critical role in communicating information to players and creating smooth, interactive gameplay. In this course, you'll build a UI/UX mockup for a mobile game while exploring design methodologies and wireframing techniques. These techniques will provide you new ways to approach UI/UX game design and to meaningfully apply iterative design to optimize your game's experience.

No experience is needed to dive into this course.

You will learn how to:

  • Understand users with user stories
  • Create definitive design criteria
  • Utilize wireframes for mockups
  • Apply common design conventions
  • Test and iterate design choices
  • Recognize design processes

... and more!

introtogodot4gamedevelopment2025edition.human_name: Intro to Godot 4 Game Development (2025 Edition)
introtogodot4gamedevelopment2025edition.description_text:
Start your game development journey with Godot — the powerful, open-source game engine!

From its beginner-friendly workflow to its robust capabilities for professionals, mastering Godot opens up endless possibilities in the world of game development. In this course, you'll explore the essential features of Godot by gaining hands-on experience in core development tools, 2D design, 3D environments, and coding gameplay behaviors with GDScript from start to finish.

Dive in and gain the foundations you'll need to make RPGs, survival games, and more with Godot!

You’ll learn how to:

  • Navigate the Godot editor
  • Utilize core editing tools
  • Understand Nodes and Scenes
  • Work with 2D & 3D assets
  • Script gameplay behaviors with GDScript
  • Develop a basic interactive game

... and more!

introtogamedevelopmentwithgamemaker.human_name: Intro to Game Development with GameMaker
introtogamedevelopmentwithgamemaker.description_text:
Learn to create your own 2D games with GameMaker!

GameMaker is one of the most popular engines available, featuring beginner-friendly architecture and cross-platform capabilities. In this course, you'll explore the fundamentals of working with GameMaker's tools while building a complete but simple game where the player must dodge an increasing number of projectiles to survive. These skills will provide you the foundations you need to start working with GameMaker in general and prepare you to build any sort of game you can imagine.

No prior experience is needed for this course!

You will learn how to:

  • Work with sprites, audio, & objects
  • Create and design 2D levels
  • Implement movement & collisions
  • Understand the eventing system
  • Code with GameMaker Language (GML)
  • Add UI elements

... and more!

developanidleclickerfromscratchingamemak.human_name: Develop an Idle Clicker from Scratch in GameMaker
developanidleclickerfromscratchingamemak.description_text:
Create your own idle clicker game in GameMaker!

Idle clicker games are a popular and engaging genre, perfect for budding developers or those who want to focus on casual games. In this course, you'll create a rewarding idle clicker game from scratch using GameMaker - mastering common mechanics like auto-clickers that can be used across many projects. These skills will not just enable you to build idle clickers, but give you skills with sprites, particles, and more that can be applied in other genres.

A basic understanding of GameMaker and GML is needed for this course.

You'll learn how to:

  • Develop core clicker game logic
  • Implement an auto-clicker system
  • Create dynamic sprites and backgrounds
  • Design a simple, functional main menu
  • Add particle effects for depth
  • Integrate sound effects

... and more!

learngameoptimizationforgodot4.description_text:
Explore methods for optimizing games made with Godot!

Game optimization is a vital process in game development to ensure your games work smoothly and efficiently. In this course, you'll discover how to use Godot's profiling tools and common techniques like level of detail to improve how games run. These skills will allow you to better leverage finite system resources and enhance how you critically approach your code bases and game setups.

A basic understanding of Godot and GDScript is needed for this course.

You will learn how to:

  • Adjust level-of-detail for 3D models
  • Use the multi-mesh instance node
  • Identify resource-intensive scripts
  • Pinpoint inefficient visual components
  • Monitor game performance in real-time
  • Improve occlusion culling

... and more!

godot4mini-projects2025edition.description_text:
Learn essential game development tools through engaging Godot mini-projects!

Godot is a leading open-source game engine known for its flexibility in creating both 2D and 3D games. In this course, you'll create four practical mini-projects designed to solidify your grasp on crucial game mechanics and programming concepts. From mouse input handling to 2D physics systems and collision detection, these hands-on projects will form the foundation needed to build more complex, complete games in the future.

You’ll learn how to:

  • Implement mouse-click-driven interactions
  • Work with Godot’s physics engine
  • Detect collisions and handle responses
  • Use loops to automate complex systems
  • Create dynamic UI for player interaction
  • Communicate between scripts

... and more!

completeunrealenginecpluspluscourse_buil.human_name: The Complete Unreal Engine C++ Course - Build an FPS
completeunrealenginecpluspluscourse_buil.description_text:
Develop a complete first-person shooter in Unreal Engine using C++ programming!

First-person shooters are popular for their performance and interactivity, and C++ empowers developers to create them efficiently. In this course, you'll build a fully-fledged FPS survival game with Unreal Engine and C++ while learning to create enemy waves, pickups, and other interactive game elements. These advanced techniques will enable you to leverage more customized FPS features with C++ and approach Unreal Engine development in a whole new way.

You will learn how to:

  • Create and program enemy classes
  • Implement wave-based enemy systems
  • Add various types of pickups
  • Manage game environments effectively
  • Facilitate cross-class communication
  • Code dynamic weapon systems

... and more!

buildareal-timestrategymini-gamewithgame.human_name: Build a Real-Time Strategy Mini-Game with GameMaker
buildareal-timestrategymini-gamewithgame.description_text:
Craft an immersive RTS mini-game using GameMaker!

Real-time strategy games captivate players with their dynamic gameplay and strategic depth, allowing them to control units and outmaneuver opponents in real time. In this course, you'll tackle core aspects of RTS games like enemy pathfinding and player controls while creating a fully functional, minimalistic strategy game. These skills will provide you not just the base to work with strategy games, but new ways to implement enemy AI for other genres.

A basic understanding of GameMaker and GML is needed for this course.

You'll learn how to:

  • Implement efficient enemy pathfinding
  • Create maps using tilesets
  • Develop basic combat mechanics
  • Add immersive audio components
  • Enhance visuals with particle effects
  • Design intuitive game menus

... and more!

constructamobilephysicsgameinunity.human_name: Construct a Mobile Physics Game in Unity
constructamobilephysicsgameinunity.description_text:
Embrace the unique aspects of mobile touch gestures to build a physics-based Unity game. You'll explore various uses of gravity, drag, collisions, and more to create a game where players are slingshotted at enemies via dragging touch gestures. With the help of the Unity Device Simulator, you'll also learn how to tailor your project to various mobile devices - all skills which can be applied to other mobile and non-mobile game projects!

You will learn how to:

  • Simulate various mobile devices
  • Manipulate Unity's physics
  • Code drag gestures to launch players
  • Improve the camera with parallax
  • Set up enemies and levels with collisions
  • Create a mobile-friendly UI

unrealenginemini-projects.description_text:
Expand your skills with Unreal's Blueprints Visual Scripting system!

Mastering scripting and algorithms is essential to all game creation. You'll build three separate mini-projects while exploring user input, loops, and much more with Unreal Engine. These principles will provide the foundations to expand your Unreal skills further and to build multiple styles of games.

Basic skills in Unreal Engine and the Blueprints Visual Scripting system are needed to take this course.

You will learn how to:

  • Change objects via script
  • Spawn and destroy Actors
  • Detect mouse and keyboard input
  • Use loops, conditionals, and more
  • Move players with camera direction
  • Expand projects with added features

... and more!

exploreaudioforgodot4games.description_text:
Implement audio for your Godot games!

Audio is an important facet of many game genres for creating atmosphere, immersion, and gameplay feedback. In this course, you'll dive into various ways you can implement audio in Godot as well as how to set up volume control settings for players. These skills will give you the foundations to add audio to any Godot game and enhance the overall game feel.

A basic understanding of Godot and GDScript is needed for this course.

You will learn how to:

  • Add general background music
  • Implement footsteps for player movement
  • Create the Doppler effect
  • Set up reverb zones
  • Separate audio tracks with buses
  • Develop in-game volume controls

... and more!

builda25dfarmingrpgwithunrealengine.human_name: Build a 2.5D Farming RPG with Unreal Engine
builda25dfarmingrpgwithunrealengine.description_text:
Build a farming simulation game using Unreal Engine!

Farming simulation games offer players the chance to create, grow, and manage their own virtual farms, combining strategic planning with RPG-like gameplay to create an immersive experience. In this course, you’ll develop a 2.5D farming simulation from scratch – covering core features like player controls, farming mechanics, and a basic economic system. These skills will give you the tools you need to create more complex farming games and expand into other genres with Unreal Engine.

You’ll learn how to:

  • Set up player movement and inputs
  • Add interactive farming mechanics
  • Create a grid-based map with Blueprints
  • Implement simple game currency systems
  • Develop skip-time logic for crop growth
  • Add SFX and game feel polishing

... and more!

unityminiprojectscfundamentals.description_text:
Expand your Unity & C# fundamentals by learning to apply them in a practical setting. While building four different mini-projects, you'll learn pivotal techniques for creating C# scripts and utilizing Unity engine features to create functional, interactive experiences. Not only will you learn common gameplay features such as scoring, physics, and more, but you'll also gain the skills needed to build bigger and more complex game projects in a variety of genres.

You will learn how to:

  • Implement multiple scripts in one project
  • Build simple user interfaces
  • Deal with different user inputs
  • Detect collisions between objects
  • Access object data through scripting
  • Apply physics to objects

... and more!

coincollectorgame-godotmobileprojects.human_name: Coin Collector Game - Godot Mobile Projects
coincollectorgame-godotmobileprojects.description_text:
Master player movement for mobile games in Godot!

Mobile games allow for a robust collection of inputs - including UI-based mechanics to mimic controllers, keyboards, and more. Through this course, you'll build a time-based game where players must move around a 2D character with a keyboard-like interface to collect coins. These techniques will allow you to unlock different styles of player interactions for mobile games that can be adapted to the project's needs.

A basic understanding of Godot and GDScript is needed for this course.

You will learn how to:

  • Craft 2D player movement
  • Accept ""keyboard"" inputs via UIs
  • Work with animations
  • Spawn coins with increasing difficulty
  • Create time-based health reduction
  • Implement particle systems

... and more!

buildanarcadekartracinggameinunity.human_name: Build an Arcade Kart Racing Game in Unity
buildanarcadekartracinggameinunity.description_text:
Enhance your Unity game development skills by learning to create a 3D kart racing game. You'll explore a variety of robust techniques for creating car movement with Unity's new Input System - including adding physics for believable car movement, tracking kart position for win conditions, and more. Besides racing mechanics, you'll also learn how to turn your project into a split-screen local multiplayer game, giving you the foundations you need to expand in whatever direction you want to for racing-style games.

You will learn how to:

  • Set up kart racing inputs
  • Build a simple racing track
  • Adjust kart movement with physics
  • Create systems for tracking race position
  • Control game flow with countdowns and win conditions
  • Implement split-screen multiplayer

... and more!

createaracinggameinunrealengine.human_name: Create a Racing Game in Unreal Engine
createaracinggameinunrealengine.description_text:
Make an arcade-style racing game in Unreal Engine!

Whether stylized or hyper-realistic, racing games are a popular genre due to their all-ages nature and easy-to-understand mechanics. In this course, you'll build a racing game while learning how to set up a car and a track that can manage laps. These techniques will give you the foundations to expand any sort of racing game and gain a deeper understanding of Blueprints techniques for vehicles in general.

A basic understanding of Unreal Engine and Blueprints Visual Scripting is needed for this course.

You will learn how to:

  • Implement a race track environment
  • Add inputs suited to vehicles
  • Set up a race car
  • Detect racing progress
  • Control UIs and win conditions
  • Rig additional cars in Blender

... and more!

magicavoxelforbeginners_createvoxelgamea.human_name: MagicaVoxel for Beginners - Create Voxel Game Assets
magicavoxelforbeginners_createvoxelgamea.description_text:
Not an artist, but eager to create Minecraft-style voxel art models for your Unity games? Discover how to build your own 3D game models with MagicaVoxel - the free program that will enable you to build simple game models and environment. No experience in MagicaVoxel, 3D modeling or artistic experience is required - you will be shown how to use the essential tools from scratch, and how to export them into Unity.

Topics included
  • Using the different brushes and tools
  • Camera controls to navigate your scene
  • Creating a voxel art tree, a character and a lanscape
  • Importing models into Unity
  • Working with color palettes

... and more!

introtovisualshadersingodot4.human_name: Intro to Visual Shaders in Godot 4
introtovisualshadersingodot4.description_text:
Unlock the power of visual shaders in Godot 4!

Shaders are essential for creating stunning visual effects in games and applications by manipulating 2D and 3D graphics at the pixel level. In this course, you’ll dive into the versatile world of visual shaders using Godot 4's intuitive visual shading node system to craft a variety of 2D effects. These techniques will supply you with the ability to create and customize visual effects, setting you up to develop fully-fledged projects that are as visually appealing as they are innovative.

You will learn how to:

  • Create and configure custom shaders
  • Update color and transparency efficiently
  • Design custom shapes with textures
  • Modify positions of 2D graphics
  • Utilize nodes in shader creation
  • Control visual parameters dynamically

... and more!

introtoecsforunity6.description_text:
Revolutionize your Unity projects with ECS!

The Entity Component System (ECS) transforms game development in Unity by providing modern techniques to enhance performance and modularity. In this course, you'll explore the setup, usage, and benefits of ECS within Unity, enabling you to make complex projects with streamlined, efficient code. These skills will empower you to create games and apps that integrate high numbers of objects and calculations for large-scale projects.

An intermediate understanding of Unity is needed for this course.

You'll learn how to:

  • Set up ECS in Unity
  • Create a massive ball spawner
  • Develop a basic player controller
  • Utilize multi-threading for performance
  • Implement modular programming concepts
  • Understand ECS structure

... and more!

introtoriggingmodelsinblender.human_name: Intro to Rigging Models in Blender
introtoriggingmodelsinblender.description_text:
Prepare your 3D models for animation by learning the fundamentals of rigging!

Rigging is an important technique for 3D animation by which one creates a skeletal-like armature that can be manipulated to move parts of the 3D mesh around. You'll discover everything required for rigging - from setting up the ""bones"" to weight painting and controlling which parts of the mesh are affected by each bone. By the end, you'll have the foundations you'll need to master rigging any kind of 3D model and expand your skills in creating custom assets.

You will learn how to:

  • Create bones to build an armature
  • Connect your armature and 3D mesh
  • Control affected vertices with weight painting
  • Export rigged models
  • Apply Mixamo animations to your models

createacomplete2dactionrpgingamemaker.human_name: Create a Complete 2D Action RPG in GameMaker
createacomplete2dactionrpgingamemaker.description_text:
Craft a complete 2D Action RPG with GameMaker!

2D Action RPGs captivate players through their intricate combat mechanics and immersive worlds - making them a popular choice for both developers and gamers. In this course, you'll develop a feature-rich action RPG from start to finish with diverse mechanics such as enemy AI, player-controlled combat systems, and more. By the end of this course, you'll not only have a fully-fledged action RPG but also possess the skills to craft increasingly complex RPGs in GameMaker.

You will learn how to:

  • Control player movement via keyboard
  • Implement a robust inventory system
  • Develop engaging enemy AI behavior
  • Add particle effects, sounds, and animations
  • Craft a multi-weapon combat system
  • Leverage tilesets for level design

... and more!

makeaminiturn-basedrpgfromscratchingamem.human_name: Make a Mini Turn-Based RPG from Scratch in GameMaker
makeaminiturn-basedrpgfromscratchingamem.description_text:
Build a mini turn-based RPG from scratch in GameMaker!

In today's rapidly evolving game market, turn-based RPGs stand out for their strategic depth and replay value. In this course, you'll master the art of creating a turn-based battle system reminiscent of old-school RPGs from start to finish using the GameMaker engine. These skills will set you on a path to crafting fully-fledged RPGs and give you hands-on experience crafting modular and complex combat.

A basic understanding of GameMaker and GML is needed for this course.

You will learn how to:

  • Design a simple main menu
  • Manage a turn-based battle system
  • Implement multiple attack types
  • Modify character stats using inheritance
  • Detect win/loss conditions
  • Create dynamic particle effects and SFX

... and more!

buildacompletemini2dgameenginewithc.human_name: Build a Complete Mini 2D Game Engine with C#
buildacompletemini2dgameenginewithc.description_text:
Construct a custom 2D game engine from scratch!

Creating your own 2D game engine gives you complete control and customization over your game development process, enabling you to tailor its features to fit project-specific needs. In this course, you'll build a comprehensive game engine using C#, mastering the fundamentals of game engines from rendering to input handling. These skills will not only enable you to make 2D games from complete scratch, but give you hands-on experience and opportunities to break boundaries in game design.

You’ll learn how to:

  • Detect and react to user input
  • Render visual elements with SFML
  • Manage game objects and properties
  • Work with physics using Aether Physics
  • Transition seamlessly between game scenes
  • Build a simple 2D game

... and more!

care_org.description_text:
Donations to support Care.org are made to  PayPal Giving Fund, subject to its policies.
 
Founded in 1945 with the creation of the CARE Package®, CARE is a leading humanitarian organization fighting global poverty. CARE places special focus on working alongside women and girls. Equipped with the proper resources women and girls have the power to lift whole families and entire communities out of poverty. In 2022, CARE worked in over 110 countries, reaching more than 170 million people through 1,600 projects.

exploregameoptimizationinunity6.description_text:
Boost your Unity game performance by exploring optimization techniques!

Game optimization is critical for delivering smooth and efficient gaming experiences - especially in larger-scale projects. In this course, you'll learn how to enhance game performance in Unity by leveraging analysis tools and applying advanced optimization techniques. This knowledge will enable you to craft fully-fledged games that run seamlessly no matter their complexity or size.

An intermediate understanding of Unity is required for this course.

You'll learn how to:

  • Utilize Unity’s Profiler effectively
  • Analyze scenes with Frame Debugger
  • Implement static and real-time lighting
  • Apply static batching techniques
  • Optimize with Level of Detail (LOD)
  • Master occlusion culling strategies

... and more!

introtothegamedevelopmentindustry.human_name: Intro to the Game Development Industry
introtothegamedevelopmentindustry.description_text:
Learn how the video game industry works!

Video games are a well-established, profitable industry with unique characteristics that support the development process. You'll explore the industry's structure by learning the overall stages of development, how work is divided by role, and more. This information will help you interact with the game industry with solid footing and have a greater understanding of how games are made.

No prior experience with the game industry is needed.

You'll learn all about:

  • Job roles & responsibilities
  • Large vs. small companies
  • The development cycle
  • IP copyrights
  • NDAs

... and more!

✅ Explore the foundations of clustering, dimensionality reduction, and kernel methods
✅ Build theoretical intuition for model selection, cross-validation, and performance metrics

Includes lifetime access, downloadable source files, evaluated coding challenges, and quizzes—all in one course.

If you want to master machine learning from the inside out—this theory collection is your essential guide. Enroll now and build the foundation that makes you a truly expert ML practitioner.

✅ Build your own ChatGPT clone in minutes with fully formatted multi-line responses

✅ Automate everyday tasks: grammar correction, translation, text simplification, and summarization
✅ Generate, explain, debug, and refactor code using prompt engineering in Python

✅ Understand how image processing works—explore color spaces, contours, edges, and regions of interest

Each module is packed with hands-on projects, visualizations, and code walkthroughs to help you apply what you learn immediately.

Unlock unlimited learning—lifetime access, downloadable projects, auto-graded coding practice, and quizzes galore!

If you want to build intelligent vision applications—from face detection to real-time analysis—this course gives you everything you need. Enroll now and bring your computer vision projects to life with Python and OpenCV.

americancancersociety.description_text:
Donations to support American Cancer Society are made to PayPal Giving Fund, subject to its policies.

The American Cancer Society is committed to saving lives from cancer and reducing the threat of the disease, not just in the United States, but globally as well. Cancer causes 1 in 8 deaths worldwide and is rapidly becoming a global pandemic. Our global work is focused on preventing cancer, saving lives, diminishing suffering, catalyzing a local response in the countries where we work, and shaping the global policy agenda.

The American Cancer Society does not endorse any product or service.
